Before establishing IT key risk indicators (KRIs), it is essential to define the IT risk and security framework. The risk and security framework outlines the structure, processes, policies, and methodologies that the organization will use to identify, assess, mitigate, and manage IT risks effectively. It provides the foundational structure within which KRIs are developed and implemented.

By establishing a comprehensive risk and security framework, organizations can ensure consistency and alignment in their approach to managing IT risks. This framework helps define the scope of IT risk management activities, establish risk tolerance levels, and identify critical assets and vulnerabilities that need to be monitored through KRIs.
You need to identify the risk before implementing any KRI(s). In conclusion, the answer should be A.

discussion.content:

B. Develop and disseminate an applicable policy.

Developing and disseminating a clear policy establishes guidelines and expectations for employees regarding the protection of data on personal devices. It provides a foundation for understanding the organization's stance on this matter and sets the stage for further actions, such as training and awareness initiatives.

While other options, such as training and disclaimers, are also important, having a well-communicated policy is a fundamental step in establishing a framework for data protection.

An enterprise's strategic change requires an IT strategic initiative re-evaluation. Which of the following BEST indicates that an established IT governance framework could handle the re-evaluation?

choices.B: Inclusion of IT portfolio management procedures with strategic change review activities
choices.C: Development of a business case to evaluate the impact of the strategic change
choices.D: Holding IT investments until an analysis of the strategic change impact was complete
choices.A: Creation of an IT steering committee to align the IT strategic initiatives to the recent change

comments.content: An established IT governance framework typically includes procedures for managing IT portfolios. By including IT portfolio management procedures with strategic change review activities, the framework can effectively assess how the strategic change impacts the existing IT initiatives and investments. This ensures that IT resources are aligned with the enterprise's strategic objectives and that adjustments can be made as necessary to support the changes in direction. This option reflects a proactive approach to managing IT resources in response to strategic changes within the organization.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Incorporating IT portfolio management procedures with strategic change review activities suggests a structured and integrated approach to reassessing IT strategic initiatives in light of organizational changes.

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST indicates that a change management process has been implemented successfully?

comments.content: Outcome measures provide tangible evidence of the effectiveness of the change management process. These measures indicate whether the desired outcomes of the change initiative have been achieved. Success can be assessed by evaluating whether the intended changes have been realized, such as improved performance, increased efficiency, enhanced employee satisfaction, or other specific goals of the change effort. Outcome measures provide valuable insights into the impact of the change management process on the organization and its ability to adapt to and sustain change over time. Therefore, outcome measures best indicate the successful implementation of a change management process.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
success of the change management process in achieving its intended goals and delivering value to the organization

While all of the options are important considerations when planning for long-term IT service delivery, the most important one is whether the IT organization is able to sustain business requirements. As the business unit grows and its demands change, the IT organization must be able to adapt and provide the necessary services to support the business. A service-oriented IT organization model can help achieve this by aligning IT services with business needs and ensuring that the IT organization is able to respond quickly to changing requirements. The other options listed are also important considerations, but they are secondary to ensuring that the IT organization can sustain business requirements.

IT supports the organization through a risk management approach; ensuring that strategic objectives will not be jeopardized by IT failures (or the impact/ loss) felt by the organization as a result of IT disruptions that support critical business functions can be mitigated, or even the the likelihood of these unpleasantries being realized being reduced.
